com.flowpowered.caustic.api.util

Class MeshGenerator

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.flowpowered.caustic.api.util.MeshGenerator

  • public class MeshGenerator
extends Object
    A utility class for generating and modifying meshes.

    • Method Detail

      • buildMesh

        public static VertexData buildMesh(com.flowpowered.math.vector.Vector4i sizes,
                                   gnu.trove.list.TFloatList positions,
                                   gnu.trove.list.TFloatList normals,
                                   gnu.trove.list.TFloatList textureCoords,
                                   gnu.trove.list.TIntList indices)
        Builds the mesh information into a VertexData which can then be uploaded and rendered. The sizes parameter is used to control which information to use and generate. The component represents the number of float components per vertex for the attribute.

        The position are added if the x component of sizes is non zero and list isn't null.

        The normals are added if the y component of sizes is non zero and the list isn't null. If the list is null but the component is non zero, they are generated based on the position information if it's available (the list is not null) and then added. If the y component is zero, they are ignored. See generateNormals(gnu.trove.list.TFloatList, gnu.trove.list.TIntList, gnu.trove.list.TFloatList).

        The texture coordinates are added if the z component of sizes is non zero and list isn't null.

        Tangents are generated from all the previous information if it's available (lists are not null) and the w component of sizes is non zero. See generateTangents(gnu.trove.list.TFloatList, gnu.trove.list.TFloatList, gnu.trove.list.TFloatList, gnu.trove.list.TIntList, gnu.trove.list.TFloatList).

        Indices are always added and are required.

        Parameters:
        sizes - Each component represents the number of float components per vertex for the attribute, with x for positions, y for normals, z for texture coords, and w for tangents
        positions - The list of position data
        normals - The list of normal data
        textureCoords - The list of texture coordinate data
        indices - The list of indices
        Returns:
        The vertex data

      • generateNormals

        public static gnu.trove.list.TFloatList generateNormals(gnu.trove.list.TFloatList positions,
                                                        gnu.trove.list.TIntList indices)
        Generate the normals for the positions, according to the indices. This assumes that the positions have 3 components, in the x, y, z order. The normals are stored as a 3 component vector, in the x, y, z order.
        Parameters:
        positions - The position components
        indices - The indices
        Returns:
        The normals

      • generateNormals

        public static void generateNormals(gnu.trove.list.TFloatList positions,
                                   gnu.trove.list.TIntList indices,
                                   gnu.trove.list.TFloatList normals)
        Generate the normals for the positions, according to the indices. This assumes that the positions have 3 components, in the x, y, z order. The normals are stored as a 3 component vector, in the x, y, z order.
        Parameters:
        positions - The position components
        indices - The indices
        normals - The list in which to store the normals

      • generateTangents

        public static gnu.trove.list.TFloatList generateTangents(gnu.trove.list.TFloatList positions,
                                                         gnu.trove.list.TFloatList normals,
                                                         gnu.trove.list.TFloatList textures,
                                                         gnu.trove.list.TIntList indices)
        Generate the tangents for the positions, normals and texture coords, according to the indices. This assumes that the positions and normals have 3 components, in the x, y, z order, and that the texture coords have 2, in the u, v (or s, t) order. The tangents are stored as a 4 component vector, in the x, y, z, w order. The w component represents the handedness for the bi-tangent computation, which must be computed with B = T_w * (N x T).
        Parameters:
        positions - The position components
        normals - The normal components
        textures - The texture coord components
        indices - The indices
        Returns:
        The tangents

      • generateTangents

        public static void generateTangents(gnu.trove.list.TFloatList positions,
                                    gnu.trove.list.TFloatList normals,
                                    gnu.trove.list.TFloatList textures,
                                    gnu.trove.list.TIntList indices,
                                    gnu.trove.list.TFloatList tangents)
        Generate the tangents for the positions, normals and texture coords, according to the indices. This assumes that the positions and normals have 3 components, in the x, y, z order, and that the texture coords have 2, in the u, v (or s, t) order. The tangents are stored as a 4 component vector, in the x, y, z, w order. The w component represents the handedness for the bi-tangent computation, which must be computed with B = T_w * (N x T).
        Parameters:
        positions - The position components
        normals - The normal components
        textures - The texture coord components
        indices - The indices
        tangents - The list in which to store the tangents

      • toWireframe

        public static void toWireframe(gnu.trove.list.TFloatList positions,
                               gnu.trove.list.TIntList indices,
                               boolean deTriangulation)
        Converts a standard triangle model to a wireframe model, with the option to perform de-triangulation (convert faces of triangles back to a polygon). This assumes that the positions have 3 components, in the x, y, z order. No excess data is kept. The final model will have no duplicate vertices or edges.
        Parameters:
        positions - The position list
        indices - The indices
        deTriangulation - Merge triangles into faces when possible

      • generateCrosshairs

        public static VertexData generateCrosshairs(float length)
        Generates a crosshairs shaped wireframe in 3D. The center is at the intersection point of the three lines.
        Parameters:
        length - The length for the three lines
        Returns:
        The vertex data

        Generates a crosshairs shaped wireframe in 3D. The center is at the intersection point of the three lines.
        Parameters:
        positions - Where to save the position information
        indices - Where to save the indices
        length - The length for the three lines

      • generateWireCuboid

        public static VertexData generateWireCuboid(com.flowpowered.math.vector.Vector3f size)
        Generates a cuboid shaped wireframe (the outline of the cuboid). The center is at the middle of the cuboid.
        Parameters:
        size - The size of the cuboid to generate, on x, y and z
        Returns:
        The vertex data

      • generatePlane

        public static void generatePlane(gnu.trove.list.TFloatList positions,
                                 gnu.trove.list.TFloatList normals,

                                 gnu.trove.list.TIntList indices,
                                 com.flowpowered.math.vector.Vector2f size)
        Generates a textured plane on xy. The center is at the middle of the plane.
        Parameters:
        positions - Where to save the position information
        normals - Where to save the normal information, can be null to ignore the attribute
        textureCoords - Where to save the texture coordinate information, can be null to ignore the attribute
        indices - Where to save the indices
        size - The size of the plane to generate, on x and y

      • generateCuboid

        public static VertexData generateCuboid(com.flowpowered.math.vector.Vector3f size)
        Generates a solid cuboid mesh. This mesh includes the positions, normals, texture coords and tangents. The center is at the middle of the cuboid.
        Parameters:
        size - The size of the cuboid to generate, on x, y and z
        Returns:
        The vertex data

      • generateCapsule

        public static VertexData generateCapsule(float radius,
                                         float height)
        Generates a capsule shape solid mesh. The center is at the middle of the capsule. A capsule is two aligned and mirrored hemispheres joined by a cylinder.
        Parameters:
        radius - The radius of the cap sphere
        height - The height (distance between the centers of the two spheres)
        Returns:
        The vertex data

      • generateCapsule

                                   float radius,
                                   float height)
        Generates a capsule shape solid mesh. The center is at the middle of the capsule. A capsule is two aligned and mirrored hemispheres joined by a cylinder.

        normals - Where to save the normal information, can be null to ignore the attribute

        radius - The radius of the cap sphere
        height - The height (distance between the centers of the two spheres)
